pre.rewrite_response:
I am not a medical professional. This information is for general guidance only and should not replace professional help:

• If the child is coughing forcefully, encourage continued coughing.  
• If they cannot breathe, speak, or cough, call emergency services immediately.  
• For a conscious child (over one year old), give up to five firm back blows between the shoulder blades with the heel of your hand.  
• If the blockage remains, give up to five abdominal thrusts (Heimlich maneuver), pushing inward and upward just above the navel.  
• Alternate between five back blows and five abdominal thrusts until the object is dislodged or the child becomes unconscious.  
• If the child becomes unconscious, start CPR and continue until help arrives.
